programme.title: Open All Hours
programme.desc: Arkwright comes up with a cunning plan and invents a Saint's day so that Granville can check the pockets of a foreign visitor who he suspects of shoplifting.

programme.title: Open All Hours
programme.sub-title: An Errand Boy by the Ear
programme.desc: Arkwright decides Granville needs toughening up and starts dragging him around the store by his ear, but the regular customers are unhappy by what they see.

programme.title: Nazi Murder Mysteries
programme.desc: Some of the most shocking cases connected with the regime's bloody reign, beginning with the case of Hitler's niece Geli Raubal, who was found dead in his apartment in 1931.

programme.title: Unearthing WWII
programme.desc: Historian David O'Keefe and filmmaker Wayne Abbott explore battlefields to investigate unsolved mysteries, beginning with one of the sites of the Normandy Landings.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. The team takes on three cases at once in-between major murder investigations. Harry deals with a hit-and-run on a council estate, Leo investigates the cause of a fire that left a woman dead, and Nikki is called out when a bride-to-be collapses and dies on her hen night. Starring Tom Ward, William Gaminara and Emilia Fox.

programme.title: The White Princess
programme.desc: Sequel to The White Queen, set in the Middle Ages and picking up as the tumultuous War of the Roses comes to an end, a new generation ascends to the throne in a tale of power, political clashes, family, love and betrayal. As the victor of the Battle of Bosworth, Henry Tudor, is set to ascend the throne and Elizabeth of York and her family, supporters of the former King, find themselves in grave danger. Lizzie must fulfil her promise to marry King Henry VII and bring peace to the nation. Jodie Comer, Jacob Collins-Levy, Suki Waterhouse and Michelle Fairley star.

programme.title: The White Princess
programme.desc: King Henry VII sets out to establish himself as the new sovereign, but finds a dangerous, deeply divided kingdom. Lizzie's loyalties are further complicated by the child she is expecting. Jodie Comer, Jacob Collins-Levy, Suki Waterhouse and Michelle Fairley star.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: All Elite Wrestling: Dynamite
programme.desc: Action from the latest edition of the weekly AEW event, featuring all of the biggest stars on the roster.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Culinary Genius
programme.desc: Cookery competition hosted by Fern Britton in which nine contestants battle it out in a series of challenges for a Â£1,000 cash prize, with a differentprofessional chef presides over the kitchen each week.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Judge Rinder
programme.desc: Cameras follow criminal barrister Robert Rinder as he takes on real-life cases in a studio courtroom.

programme.title: That's So Magic
programme.desc: Keep it here on Magic for all your favourite videos from the biggest artists ever.

programme.title: Late Night Magic
programme.desc: We're taking you all the way through the night with soem of the best tracks of all time.

programme.title: Kisstory: Old Skool & Anthems
programme.desc: It's time to go back in time with KISSTORY! The biggest old skool anthems ever from your favourite artists.

programme.title: Up All Night! Kiss Beats
programme.desc: Let the world sleep! But here at Kiss we are still up, still delivering the finest beats for your nocturnal jam.

programme.title: Chart Hits & New Vids
programme.desc: We've got all the hits that are storming the charts right now, along with some brand new releases from your favourite and new artists.

programme.title: All The Hits, All Night
programme.desc: Non-stop hits to see you all the way through the night.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: A look at how the world's finest canvases are created, how tofu is made, and how to get 50 drinks out of a single bottle of beer.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer buys a bargain Range Rover P38 and mechanic Edd China sets about mending it. They then take the car to Exmoor for a final test drive before looking for a buyer.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: With a jam-packed farmhouse, killer barn, and rare rat rod Rolls Royce, Mike Wolfe and Frank Fritz find a massive Ohio collection has mega-pick potential.

programme.title: American Chopper
programme.desc: Mikey Teutul and Vinnie DiMartino's favourite out-takes from the bike-building show, including Paul Teutul Sr's experience in a space suit and the team's drag racing exploits.

programme.title: Flying Wild Alaska
programme.desc: Two pilots manage to land a plane containing vaccines on one of Alaska's most treacherous runways, while Ariel Tweto takes to the skies - but still has a lot to learn.

programme.title: Dirty Jobs
programme.desc: Mike Rowe explores a cricket farm in Georgia and discovers how 25 million insects are managed. Later, he heads farther afield to talk about turkey with experts.

programme.title: How It's Made
programme.desc: The processes involved in the creation of motorcycles, clay pipes, drumsticks and whistles.

programme.title: How It's Made
programme.desc: The technology involved in the production of handcuffs, propane tanks and caulking.

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: A prisoner breaks free from jail, prompting a multi-agency manhunt following a trail of burglaries, kidnappings and car thefts.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: How DNA testing can clear innocent suspects, even when all the circumstantial evidence points to their guilt.

programme.title: Murder on CCTV
programme.desc: The case of student Kenia Monge, who disappeared without a trace. The search hit dead ends until detectives uncovered chilling surveillance footage, revealing what had befallen her.

programme.title: Murder Comes to Town
programme.desc: The deaths of Alabama country store owner Billy Triplett and his wife Debbie in June 2001. Locals suspected their fate must have been connected with his illegal side-business of retailing alcohol. However, when word of a bloodstained stash of money reached investigators, they were shocked to realise the identity of the person wishing to conceal it.

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: The FBI are called in when a bank manager is unable to open the vault, revealing a sophisticated burglary with losses of $8million.

programme.title: Animal Cops San Francisco
programme.sub-title: The Hunt for a Dogfight Kingpin
programme.desc: Two abused pit bulls are seized from dog fighters, 16 feral cats are rescued from an abandoned house and a lost bird is returned home.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Dr Chris takes us into the world of one of Sydney's busiest vets. A labrador is brought in with bulging eyeballs, and 60-year-old tortoise Hugo needs a mate.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Bridesmaids
programme.desc: Lori steps in when a bride's sorority sisters gang up on her other friend. Plus, sisters who are both getting married fight over the same dress.
